author: donschoe
content: None of the clients agree on a genesis time

author: donschoe
content:
Teku says

```
16:16:32.326 INFO  - Minimum genesis time reached
```

Which is not correct as the min genesis time is 14:00:00 and all deposits happened before that, so it should come up with 15:00:00 (3600s delay)

author: donschoe
content:
Lighthouse says

```
May 22 17:18:07.212 INFO Minimum genesis deposit count met       block_number: 2740838, deposit_count: 6, service: beacon            
May 22 17:18:21.275 INFO Imported deposit log(s)                 new: 2, total: 6, latest_block: 2740838, service: beacon            
May 22 17:18:21.297 INFO Inspected new eth1 block                block_number: 2740838, msg: did not trigger genesis, service: beacon
```

Which is not entirely clear why id does not see a genesis yet.

author: donschoe
content:
Prysm says

```
[2020-05-22 17:22:05]  INFO powchain: Minimum number of validators reached for beacon-chain to start ChainStartTime=2020-05-22 15:00:00 +0200 CEST            
```

Which is correct apparently, but it does not start counting slots. It's just hanging in there.

author: donschoe
content: I'll try again with another genesis time

author: donschoe
content: But I believe this should be addressed

author: paulhauner

author: protolambda
content:
The 6 genesis deposits happened about 9.40 hours ago: https://goerli.etherscan.io/address/0x9eED6A5741e3D071d70817beD551D0078e9a2706
And the genesis delay is set to 5 hours: https://github.com/goerli/witti/blob/3c685cc239564be92be45caa4e36121d7a3e36e9/lighthouse/config.yaml#L40
So that sounds about right
